# Hi, I'm Albert Rapp.

I'm a mathematics PhD student with a passion for R, data visualization, Shiny and statistics/machine learning. On this blog, I share and teach what I learn.

To get started, you can check out my most popular on content below. You can find me on [{{< fa brands twitter >}}](https://twitter.com/rappa753) or [{{< fa brands github >}}](https://github.com/AlbertRapp) and [{{< fa brands youtube >}}](https://www.youtube.com/user/Alfrodo123).
:::

# Data Visualization

##### [Recreating the Storytelling with Data look with ggplot](posts/ggplot2-tips/10_recreating_swd_look/10_recreating_swd_look.html)

The SWD is a great look for any visual. With ggplot you can recreate it.

##### [Storytelling in ggplot using rounded rectangles](posts/ggplot2-tips/11_rounded_rectangles/11_rounded_rectangles.html)

Rounded rectangles with `{ggchicklet}` can give your bar chart a different feel.

##### [How to use Fonts and Icons in ggplot](posts/ggplot2-tips/08_fonts_and_icons/08_fonts_and_icons.html)

Spice up your visuals with different fonts and icons.

##### [4 Ways to use colors in ggplot more efficiently](posts/ggplot2-tips/07_four_ways_colors_more_efficiently/07_four_ways_colors_more_efficiently.html)

Avoid plots that look like a [gnome just puked a rainbow](https://giphy.com/gifs/gravity-falls-i-couldnt-put-it-up-last-night---because-either-id-flip-out-and-wosNsGaxczbIA). Use colors effectively.

# Stats/ML

##### [Yet Again: R + Data Science](https://yards.albert-rapp.de/)

Course I taught at Ulm University. Inspired by the legendary [R4DS](https://r4ds.had.co.nz/), I take a tour through the data science workflow. Includes intro to `{shiny}` and `{tidymodels}`.

##### [The ultimate beginner's guide to generalized linear models (GLMs)](posts/14_GLMs/14_GLMS.qmd)

Both Poisson and logistic regression are GLMs. I explain the fundamentals.

##### [Statistical Concepts (A Shiny App)](https://rappa.shinyapps.io/estimator-variance/)

Interactive webapp I built to teach a selection of statistical concepts. Will be extended once I master `{golem}`.
:::
